;蔡英文总统周五表示，台湾将在下周的 APEC 峰会上强调该地区和平的重要性是台湾和中国大陆均为其成员并举行官员会议的少数国际机构之一。

;

;由 21 名成员组成的亚太经合组织 (APEC) 论坛将在旧金山举行第 30 届 APEC 峰会这是自 2011 年以来首次由美国主办。

;

;中国声称拥有主权并实行民主统治的台湾以“中华台北”身份参加 APEC，并且不派总统参加峰会，因此面临着越来越大的军事压力

;

;蔡英文在总统府向记者表示，她希望代表APEC的第一个信息是芯片巨头台积电;(2330.TW);，创始人张忠谋在峰会上发文称，台湾致力于推动地区和平与繁荣。

;

;“在世界面临各种挑战之际，我们要共同努力减少地区冲突，共同为地区经济发展营造和平稳定的环境。”

;

;蔡英文补充说：“台湾是国际社会中可靠、安全、值得信赖的伙伴。”

;

;张继蔡之后发表讲话，表示他相信没有一个 APEC 成员会反对和平、繁荣与发展。

;

;总统和第六次代表蔡英文出席 APEC 峰会的张都没有提出问题。

;

;APEC 传统上是中国和世界上为数不多的论坛之一。台湾话题，即使只是顺便聊聊。

;

;中国尚未正式确认习近平主席出席今年的峰会。

;

;92 岁的张有简短的;去年在曼谷举行的亚太经合组织峰会上与习近平聊天;罕见的高层互动。

;

;蔡英文2016年上台后，中国认为她是分裂分子，切断了与台湾的正式对话机制。蔡英文表示，只有台湾人民才能决定台湾的未来，并强烈反对中国的主权主张。

;

;虽然张现在已从台积电退休，但作为台湾芯片行业的元老政治家，他仍然具有影响力。

;加沙官员表示，以色列周五对至少三家医院或其附近发动了空袭，进一步强调了巴勒斯坦飞地的;不稳定的卫生系统;，因为它正在努力应对在以色列与哈马斯武装分子的战争中，数千人受伤或流离失所。

;

;加沙卫生部发言人阿什拉夫·齐德拉 (Ashraf Al-Qidra) 告诉 Al半岛电视台。

;

;医疗设施包括加沙最大的医院;Al Shifa;，以色列称哈马斯在那里隐藏了指挥中心和隧道，但哈马斯否认了这一指控。 Qidra 表示，以色列袭击了加沙城医疗中心的庭院，造成人员伤亡，但他没有提供细节。

;

;以色列军方没有立即对 Qidra 的声明发表评论，路透社无法独立核实该声明。

;

;加沙的医院一直在努力照顾以色列长达一个月的军事行动的受害者，该行动的目的是消灭巴勒斯坦激进组织哈马斯，因为;医疗用品、清洁水和发电机燃料;耗尽。

;

;加沙卫生部表示，加沙 35 家医院中的 18 家和其他 40 家卫生中心都已耗尽由于轰炸损坏或缺乏燃料而停止服务。

;

;巴勒斯坦媒体周五发布了 Al Shifa 的视频片段，路透社无法立即证实该视频的真实性，据称该视频显示了以色列人袭击的后果对一个停车场的袭击，流离失所的巴勒斯坦人在那里避难，记者们正在观察。

;

;在担架上放置一名男子的尸体旁边可以看到一滩血迹。

;

;”随着附近（Al Shifa）持续不断的罢工和战斗，我们严重关切那里数千名寻求医疗和庇护的平民的福祉，其中包括许多儿童，”人权观察组织在社交媒体网站X上表示。 Qidra 表示，Al-Rantisi 儿科医院和 Al-Nasr 儿童医院周五“目睹了一系列直接袭击和轰炸”。他说，对兰提西医院场地的袭击导致车辆着火，但已部分扑灭。

;

;以色列发动袭击，以回应哈马斯 10 月 10 日从加沙对以色列南部进行跨境袭击。以色列称，1400 人（其中大部分是平民）在 7 日的袭击中丧生，约 240 人被扣为人质。以色列称其在加沙失去了 35 名士兵。

;

;巴勒斯坦官员表示，截至周四，已有 10,812 名加沙居民在空袭和炮击中丧生，其中约 40% 是儿童。随着食物和水等基本物资耗尽，炮击使平民流离失所，一场人道主义灾难已经展开。

;

;以色列军方表示，有证据表明哈马斯利用 Al Shifa 和印度尼西亚医院等其他医院来进行人道主义灾难。隐藏加沙地下广阔隧道网络的指挥所和入口点。它说它不针对平民，并且允许一些受伤的巴勒斯坦平民进入埃及接受治疗。

;

;但以色列向加沙市中心的军事推进，使坦克进入约1.2公里（3/4）据居民称，希法的一英里）对以色列将如何解释有关保护医疗中心和在那里避难的流离失所者的国际法提出了疑问。

;

;对 ;难民营;、医疗车队和附近的医院已经在一些人中引发了激烈的争论以色列;西方盟友;对其军队遵守

;

;美国总统乔·拜登周四在X上发帖表示，以色列“有义务区分恐怖分子和平民，并充分遵守国际法。”

;

;白宫周四表示，以色列同意每天暂停在加沙北部部分地区的军事行动四个小时，但没有迹象表明战斗已经造成了这片海滨飞地的废墟。

;<白宫国家安全发言人约翰·柯比表示，暂停行动是重要的第一步，这将使人们能够沿着两条人道主义走廊逃离，并可用于释放人质。

;

;但以色列总理本杰明·内塔尼亚胡表示，任何停顿都将是分散的，并且没有正式确认重复休息的计划。

;

;当被问及是否会“停止”战斗时，内塔尼亚胡在福克斯新闻频道上说：“不。与哈马斯敌人、哈马斯恐怖分子的战斗仍在继续，但在特定地点，在这里或那里几个小时的特定时间内，我们希望为平民安全离开战斗区域提供便利，我们正在”

;

;在加沙北部的地面上，没有关于战斗平静的报道。双方都报告说，在激烈的巷战中给对方造成了重大伤亡。

;;美国总统乔·拜登举办的一场活动中展示了幽灵枪套件的一部分，该活动宣布了打击幽灵枪犯罪的措施，网址为美国华盛顿白宫，2022 年 4 月 11 日。路透社/Kevin Lamarque/档案照片;
;

;联邦上诉法院周四裁定，拜登政府无权通过一项旨在遏制名为“;幽灵枪;”，执法部门很难追踪。

;

;位于新奥尔良的美国第五巡回上诉法院的三名法官组成的小组;站在;一组枪支拥有者、枪支权利团体和制造商的一边，宣布酒精、烟草、枪支和爆炸物局的 2022 年规则“非法。”

;

;该小组完全由共和党前总统唐纳德·特朗普任命的法官组成，基本上维持了德克萨斯州法官反对该规则的裁决，该规则针对的是此类自制武器的迅速扩散。

;<该规则更新了 1968 年《枪支管制法》中“枪支”、“枪身”和“接收器”的定义，以应对幽灵枪的兴起，这些幽灵枪可以通过网上或商店购买的套件进行组装，而无需使用任何配件。背景调查。

;

;美国巡回法官库尔特·恩格尔哈特 (Kurt Engelhardt) 在为第五巡回法庭小组撰写的文章中表示，ATF 的规则“藐视明确的法律文本，并以公共政策的名义超出了立法对机构权力的限制”。

;

;“ATF 在颁布最终规则时，试图承担国会的职责，在枪支管制方面‘做点什么’，”他写道。 “但为我们的国家制定法律不是执行机构的职权范围。”

;

;美国司法部和 ATF 没有回应置评请求。但在已经寻求美国最高法院介入此案之后，政府可能会上诉。

;

;最高法院之前曾两次;八月;和;10 月; 根据德克萨斯州法官的裁决并批准了政府的请求，允许法规在诉讼继续期间继续有效。

;

;政府表示幽灵枪对犯罪分子和其他被禁止合法购买枪支的人（包括未成年人）很有吸引力。

;

;2021 年，执法部门在刑事调查中查获了大约 20,000 支疑似幽灵枪- 根据白宫的说法，比 2016 年增加了十倍。

;

;枪支政策联盟行动基金会原告律师 Cody Wisniewski 在一份声明中称周四的裁决是“针对 ATF 的巨大胜利，对拜登政府的枪支管制议程造成巨大打击。”

;

;An unusual statement by Israeli spy agency Mossad saying that it had helped foil a Hezbollah attack in Brazil is the latest incident to strain relations between Israel and Latin America's largest nation against the backdrop of the Gaza war.

;

;On Wednesday, Brazil arrested two people on terrorism charges as part of an operation to take down a suspected Hezbollah cell planning attacks on Brazilian soil. Later that day, ;Mossad publicly thanked; Brazil's police and said, "Given the backdrop of the war in Gaza," Hezbollah was continuing to attack Israeli, Jewish and Western targets.

;

;Mossad's comments angered Brazilian Justice Minister Flavio Dino, who on Thursday delivered a stiff rebuke to Israel, saying on social media that "Brazil is a sovereign country," and "no foreign force orders around the Brazilian Federal Police."

;

;Dino did not explicitly deny any of the details in the Israeli statement, but seemed more angered by its timing, tone and the link it drew to the current war in Gaza.

;

;"We appreciate appropriate international cooperation, but we reject any foreign authority that deems to direct Brazilian police bodies, or use our investigations for the use of propaganda or its political interests," he wrote, adding that Brazil's probe had "nothing to do with international conflicts."

;

;A Brazilian Federal Police source said Dino was angry because the Mossad statement made it look like Brazil was taking orders from Israel and could be perceived to be taking sides in the war.

;

;A spokesperson for the Israeli Prime Minister's Office, which oversees the Mossad, had no immediate comment.

;

;Dino's comments reflect growing unease among Brazilian officials with Israel's conduct in the wake of the Oct. 7 attacks by Hamas, and the subsequent bombardment of Gaza.

;

;There are still some 30 Brazilians stuck in Gaza, weeks after the conflict began, and Brazil has grown increasingly irate with Israel over their slow release, two sources said. Brazil's Foreign Ministry told Israel this week that the diplomatic relationship would become unsustainable if any harm were to befall the trapped Brazilians, the sources said.

;

;Brazilian diplomats told Reuters they could not understand why Israel was slow-walking their release, given that President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva has balanced criticism of the Hamas attacks with calls for a ceasefire.

;

;Later on Thursday, Israeli Foreign Minister Eli Cohen told his Brazilian counterpart, Mauro Vieira, that "unexpected closures" at the borders have prevented Brazilian citizens from leaving Gaza, according to Brazil's ministry.

;

;"He assured Vieira that Brazilians and their families will be on the list of foreigners allowed to cross the border tomorrow," the ministry said in a post on social media.

;

;Latin American peers such as Bolivia, Colombia and Chile have taken a much tougher line with Israel, ;severing ties; or recalling their ambassadors.

;

;Lula's team was also irked when Israel's ambassador to Brazil, Daniel Zonshine, during a visit to Brazil's Congress on Wednesday, took pictures seated alongside former President Jair Bolsonaro and other far-right politicians ahead of a private meeting.

;

;Bolsonaro, a Lula foe and staunch Israel supporter, holds no public office, has been ruled politically ineligible until 2030 and is the subject of multiple criminal probes, including one investigating whether he tried to stage a coup d'etat after losing last year's election.

;

;In an interview with O Globo newspaper after Wednesday's Federal Police operation, Zonshine said that "if (Hezbollah) chose Brazil, it's because they have people who help them."

;

;On Thursday, Federal Police chief Andrei Rodrigues told local media that Zonshine's comments had been "disrespectful."

;

;"It was a bad surprise," Rodrigues said. "I reject it completely."

;

;The Iranian government and Hezbollah, an Iran-backed group in Lebanon, could not immediately be reached for comment.

;Black Friday?不，网络星期一？没有。黄金日？绝对不。 The world's biggest shopping event happens in China each year - and it's called Singles Day.

;

;Originally a holiday to celebrate being single, as a counter to Valentine's Day, the event has grown into a weeks-long online shopping festival that peaks on Nov. 11.

;

;The idea for Singles Day had originated at China's Nanjing University back in 1993 and was originally called "Bachelor's Day." On the day, single people treat themselves with gifts and presents, while also organizing social gatherings and parties.

;

;Last year, the total value of goods sold during the shopping bonanza - also known as "Double 11" - totaled 1.15 trillion yuan ($157.97 billion), according to data from consultancy firm Bain.

;

;That is more than four times the $35.3 billion US shoppers spent last year during Cyber Week, the period from Black Friday to Cyber Monday, per data from Adobe Analytics.

;

;Cyber Monday immediately follows Black Friday, which falls on the day after the US Thanksgiving Day holiday, the busiest shopping day of the year in the United States.

;

;But growth has been slowing even as overall sales for Singles Day hit record highs, with last year's 3% rise marking the slowest increase ever. The event has in recent years lost some of its novelty with the rise of other shopping festivals in China, including the midyear "618" sales that are the country's second largest.

;

;Strict COVID-19 curbs in China impacted sales last year, but several industry experts are expecting a rebound, as the economy improves and livestream sales remain robust.

;

;"We're optimistic about growth this year because the recovery seems to be stabilizing and consumption is on a more clear upward trend," said Jacob Cooke, co-founder and CEO of Beijing-based WPIC Marketing + Technologies.

;

;His e-commerce consultancy firm expects sales for the Chinese shopping event to rise in the range between 14% and 18% from last year, which is higher than Adobe's projection for a 5.4% rise in Cyber Week sales.

;

;While ;Alibaba 9988.HK started "Double 11"; in 2009 to win over online shoppers with discounts and promotions, China's major e-commerce platforms now all take part in it.

;

;JD.com ;(9618.HK); joined in 2012 and PDD Holdings-owned ;(PDD.O); Pinduoduo has also become a significant player, offering low cost products in competition with ;Alibaba-owned Tmall and Taobao platforms;.

;

;Last year, ;Chinese shoppers spent more on essentials;, supplements, vitamins and pet-care products. Those products are expected to stay in demand this year, along with more lifestyle-focused products such as athletic wear and sports equipment.

;

;"There is enormous demand among Chinese consumers for products and services that improve their lifestyles and facilitate self-expression," Cooke said.

;

;In comparison, US shoppers last year had bought more Pokemon toys, Hot Wheels, TVs, footwear and air fryers during the key Black Friday and Cyber Monday shopping periods, according to Adobe.

;

;From 2014 until 2021, Singles Day had ;posted growth rates of about 34% annually; on average, versus Cyber Week's 17% average gain, according to data from consultancy Bain and from Adobe Analytics.

;

;Several American companies from apparel makers Nike ;(NKE.N); and Lululemon ;(LULU.O); to cosmetics firm Estee Lauder ;(EL.N); and consumer goods giant Procter & Gamble ;(PG.N); have a big presence on the Tmall marketplace and stand to benefit from the event.

;

;Last year, Apple ;(AAPL.O);, Nike and L'Oreal ;(OREP.PA); were also among the biggest winners from the event, along with Chinese home appliance makers such as Haier and Midea and sportswear brand Anta.

;

;Nike said in December "Double 11" demand in Greater China grew by mid-teens, outpacing the broader sports industry, with demand from Gen Z consumers for the brand growing by 45% during the shopping period in China on Tmall.

;

;JD.com had ;noted; Apple sold more than 1 billion yuan worth of products in the first minute of the event's final sales period.

;

;However, for this year, several global companies ranging from ;L'Oreal; to ;Estee Lauder; have taken a cautious stance around the spending spree in China during the shopping event.

;

;"The presale period of Tmall and particularly on -- in general, the Singles Day, confirms a softer trend versus a year ago," said Estee Lauder CEO Fabrizio Freda last week, adding that the company was more optimistic about the next part of the Singles Day events in November.

;

;L'Oreal CEO Nicolas Hieronimus on a post earnings call with analysts in October said it was too soon to comment on "Double 11."

;

;"The shy consumers are less shy during the big events, and we have seen that whether it's during Valentine's Day, whether it is 6/18, the market has had its best peaks of growth during this moment," Hieronimus said, adding he had lots of hope for the shopping bonanza.
